quote: Stupid quotes are only Twitters in disguise.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Where are the quotes?
author: Yousef Yousef

quote: Tweeting is talking into the abyss, filling a void in your life by avoiding real human contact.
author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

quote: Always be wary of people who use quotes. I don't know who said that.' - Murdoc Niccals
author: Gorillaz,  Gorillaz: Rise of the Ogre

quote: Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Quotes are made we to think, we have made a mistake so quotes will put us in the right way? (But can we understand them - is the best question)
author: Deyth Banger

quote: Twittersweeet [10w] Finding Twitter followers' like fishing in a lake of fisherman.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Sometimes when I try to make jokes or have a sense of humor in interviews, it doesn't go over very well. But Twitter made my life easier in this way that I didn't expect. It would have taken probably 10 times as long for people to accept my voice and my sense of humor if I didn't have Twitter.
author: Anna Kendrick

quote: People that love quotes are those short on time, but long on big ideas.
author: Bruce Edwin

quote: Quotes ain’t all that useful. Fact is, there’s more concise ways to express what you’re feelin’, like screams and moans.
author: M.C. Humphreys

quote: I hate quotations. Tell me what you know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I quote others only in order the better to express myself.
author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays

quote: Twitter is the place where I try to be more funny. And then I use Instagram just as my diary. I pull some jokes on there, but I think people have a better sense of humor on Twitter.
author: Gigi Hadid

quote: Inspirational quotes are dances of light that shine in dark places during your life.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: Life itself is a quotation.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: #quote In the harshest conditions is when we know better the people around us. En las condiciones más duras es cuando conocemos mejor a las personas que nos rodean.
author: Juan Luis Ortiz Hidalgo,  Las mil vidas del profesor Bonham

quote: Quotation confesses inferiority.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  Uncollected Writings

quote: Words of Wisdom [10w] Words of wisdom worth saying wouldfit on a T-shirt.@:::::@:::::@:::::@:::::@:::::@:::::@:::::@:::::@:::::@­:::::
author: Beryl Dov

quote: I wish, when I was first born, the first thing I said was "Quote"so the last thing I said before I died would be "Unquote.
author: Steven Wright

quote: [A] quotation is a handy thing to have about, saving one the trouble of thinking for oneself, always a laborious business."(The Record Lie)
author: A.A. Milne,  If I May

quote: I have a self-made quote: Celebrate diversity, practice acceptance and may we all choose peaceful options to conflict.
author: Donzella Michele Malone

quote: Everything is true,' he said. 'Everything anybody has ever thought.''Will you be all right?''I'll be all right,' he said, and thought, And I'm going to die. Both those are true, too.
author: Philip K. Dick,  Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?

quote: Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting.
author: John Green

quote: I love when people quote me. It makes me feel that my words have meaning. People give words power. When they speak out for things they feel, we all become alive.
author: Jennifer Megan Varnadore

quote: Quote words that affirmall men and women are yourbrothers and sisters.
author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams

quote: Famous people steal my quotes all of the time without knowing; none of it is ever very interesting though.
author: Robert DeCoteau,  The New Days: The First Son

quote: I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Every quote is like a Picasso. The meaning is different for each person and half the admirers miss the true intent and twisted humor of it all.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: In quoting others, we cite ourselves.
author: Julio Cortázar,  Around the Day in Eighty Worlds

quote: When you go on your Twitter or look down your Timeline and it's all great positivity - I love that. But at the same time, it can really divert you from what your purpose is or what you're trying to do. And I've seen artists get caught up in that.
author: Kendrick Lamar

quote: We need to be smarter than our smart phones and realize the people we are with are more important than the people we aren't with, and way more important than the strangers we hope will tweet and like and share and Instagram whatever we're sending out into the cybersphere.
author: Regina Brett

quote: Headline?"he asked."'Swing Set Needs Home,'"I said."'Desperately Lonely Swing Set Needs Loving Home,'"he said."'Lonely, Vaguely Pedophilic Swing Set Seeks the Butts of Children,'"I said.
author: John Green,  The Fault in Our Stars

quote: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: I'm not an inspirational quote kind of person.
author: Christine Teigen

quote: You write the way you think about the world. My motto in times of trouble - and I'm speaking of life, not writing - is 'no humor too black.'
author: Elizabeth McCracken

quote: ❞ [10w] "Let's cuddle like a quotation mark filling a blank page.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Where do the words gowhen we have said them?
author: Margaret Atwood,  Procedures For Underground

quote: Twitter Love [10w] ♥ ۵ 웃 유 ღ ♂ ♀ is2g, no b.s.dnt nd 8v3n, wen ive gt uaღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღღ
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Words are the clothes thoughts wear.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Words can never fully say what we want them to say, for they fumble, stammer, and break the best porcelain. The best one can hope for is to find along the way someone to share the path, content to walk in silence, for the heart communes best when it does not try to speak.
author: Margaret Weis,  Dragons of a Lost Star

quote: All the people who follow me on Twitter know my sense of humor. I sometimes forget the blogosphere will give it more weight than I intended.
author: Kurt Sutter

quote: People like rumors. They're going to say things like, 'You was at the club with Lil' Kim, and you and Kanye West got into a fist fight.' You can't get upset. You've got to keep hope alive.
author: Bernie Mac

quote: Well then,"Roen said briskly, "are you sleeping?""Yes.""Come now. A mother can tell when her son lies. Are you eating?""No,"Brigan said gravely. "I've not eaten in two months. It's a hunger strike to protest the spring flooding in the south.""Gracious,"Roen said, reaching for the fruit bowl. "Have an apple, dear.
author: Kristin Cashore,  Fire

quote: It is a good thing for an uneducated man to read books of quotations.
author: Winston S. Churchill

quote: Journalists say a thing that they know isn't true, in the hope that if they keep on saying it long enough it will be true.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: If you have to say or do something controversial, aim so that people will hate that they love it and not love that they hate it.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: Who was the guy who first looked at a cow and said 'I think I’ll drink whatever comes out of these when I squeeze ’em?
author: Bill Watterson

quote: He’s always asking: ‘Is that new? I haven’t seen that before.’ It’s like, Why don’t you mind your own business? Solve world hunger. Get out of my closet.
author: Michelle Obama

quote: Hope?” he says. “There is always hope, John. New developments have yet to present themselves. Not all the information is in. No. Don’t give up hope just yet. It’s the last thing to go. When you have lost hope, you have lost everything. And when you think all is lost, when all is dire and bleak, there is always hope.
author: Pittacus Lore,  I Am Number Four

quote: And Death spoke to them —’”“Sorry,” interjected Harry, “but Death spoke to them?”“It’s a fairy tale, Harry!”“Right, sorry. Go on.
author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
